nodes.bodyText:
This file was duplicated from droolsjbpm-build-bootstrap, which has the 7.x version (and cannot host the 8.x version because there is no 8 there).
Advantages of moving it here:

Once it extends optaplanner-parent, half of the file can be removed (url, scm, issueManagement, etc)
Less cross-repo PR's.
Easier maintenance

Disavantages:
We need to split up optaplanner's parent from build-parent (just like quarkus does).

nodes.bodyText:
So, why this pom?

The optaplanner-parent will (after step 3) hold all the metadata (url, scm, repo's, etc), maven plugin configuration (think enforcer, rules etc) etc. But it cannot hold the dependencies because optaplanner-bom extends it.
The optaplanner-build-parent will (after step 3) extend optaplanner-parent and hold all dependencies, and also import optaplanner-bom.
optaplanner-core, etc extend optaplanner-build-parent (not optaplanner-parent)

Should have empty <relativePath/> otherwise:
[WARNING] 'parent.relativePath' of POM org.optaplanner:optaplanner-bom:8.0.0-SNAPSHOT (/home/jlocker/src/github.com/kiegroup/optaplanner/optaplanner-bom/pom.xml) points at org.optaplanner:optaplanner-parent instead of org.kie:kie-user-bom-parent, please verify your project structure @ line 6, column 11

nodes.bodyText:
If I understand it correctly, the optaplanner-parent should server as a parent pom for both the optaplanner-bom and the optaplanner-build-parent.
What is the reason for the intention to define plugin configuration in the optaplanner-parent? Plugin configuration is specific for the build of the OptaPlanner project, so I would rather expect them to be defined in the optaplanner-build-parent.

commit.message: Embed content of kie-user-bom-parent to avoid littering the bom with repository elements.
